answers.answer: : (  Its back, huh?  I'd get the home health to get you some fluids going to keep you hydrated.  Its ok to take the meds.  Zofran is a great drug and its safer then most.  Its a class B which is really good.  I'm taken tons of zofran and phenergan, but I have to.  Lillys growing great, my problem is just getting her to stay in there.  This is a link to give you the facts on Zofran:http://www.safefetus.com/DrugDetail.asp?DrugId=249&TradeName=Zofran%20Injection/Tablets&TradeId=2247Also if you ever have any other questions about medications go to:www.safefetus.comI hope this helps.  Talk to your doctors again if you considering giving it a try, that way they can monitor you.  I'm going back to bed now.  Its 4 am!  I'll be in touch with you today.  I'll let you know how it goes, and you do the same!  Talk to you later!

My sister takes anti-nausea pills, along with high blood pressure pills, and insulin shots for gestational diabetes every day.  Medication has come a very long ways over the years.  I would trust that your doctors will prescribe medication that will not harm your little one.  Giving your baby the nutrition it needs to develop is very important.I have ANOTHER cold, I just got over a severe cold two weeks ago, and have ANOTHER one that started this past Friday.  I have sudafed to take but I have not given in and taken it yet.  I have been drinking lots of fluids and trying to keep the air moist to help with congestion.  I have the choice to take a medication that will make me and my baby feel sleepy and loopy but I have decided NOT to take it.  Cold medicines are not a necessity.  I know that my baby is not suffering from me having this cold.  Your baby may suffer without the proper nutrition.  I am by far NOT an expert on any of this.  I learn as I go.  =)I totally understand your fear of taking medication.  My sister has the same anxieties.
